item.title: News24 | Hundreds flee as Israel orders Gaza's main hospital evacuated
item.description: Hundreds of people fled on foot on Saturday after Israel's army ordered the evacuation of Gaza's main hospital where more than 2 000 patients, medics and displaced people were trapped by the war between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: News24 | Colorado judge lets Trump stay on ballot but says he incited riots
item.description: A Colorado state judge on Friday ruled that Donald Trump can remain on the state's presidential primary ballot, finding that while he incited political violence during the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol, he did not violate his oath of office by doing so.

item.title: News24 | Azerbaijan must allow 'safe' return to Nagorno-Karabakh: UN court
item.description: The UN's top court Friday ordered Azerbaijan to allow the safe return of people to the contested territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, which Baku seized in a lightning September offensive.

item.title: News24 | Give us our daily bread: Gaza faces flour crisis
item.description: One of the last grain warehouses in the Gaza Strip has been damaged by Israeli strikes and a key flour mill in Khan Yunis - where hundreds of thousands have fled - has stopped working for lack of fuel.

item.title: News24 | Germany to lend SA R10 billion for shift to renewables
item.description: Germany, through its KfW development bank, will on Friday sign an agreement to lend South Africa €500 million (~R10 billion) to transition away from coal-fired electricity.

item.title: News24 | EXPLAINER | What war crimes laws apply to the Israel-Palestinian conflict?
item.description: The war between Israel and Palestinian militants since the cross-border attack by Gaza's ruling Islamist group Hamas on 7 October has caused a large civilian death toll.

item.title: News24 | Ramaphosa and Zelensky hammered out first peace topics to take to Moscow over 'lengthy lunch'
item.description: At a lunch in Kyiv in June, South Africa's Cyril Ramaphosa and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky spoke informally, away from the glare of cameras and translation devices crackling in their ears, and reached an agreement on two key issues that could be taken to Moscow.

item.title: News24 | Israeli military says it uncovers Hamas command centre, weapons at Gaza hospital
item.description: Israel said it searched al-Shifa hospital without opposition, and found weapons and other proof that it had been a Hamas command post.

item.title: News24 | After battle with junta, Myanmar rebels take control of border point with India
item.description: Two days after rebel forces in Myanmar’s Chin state overran the junta’s two military bases close to the border with India, they have taken control of a border crossing point between the two countries across the tiny hilly

item.title: News24 | Flying horse escapes, wasting 20 tons of fuel
item.description: A Belgium-bound cargo plane was forced to return to New York after a horse bolted from its holding pen in mid-air, US media reported.

item.title: News24 | REPORTING NOTES | Grain and defiance: How the war has driven Ukrainians further than ever from Russia
item.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has driven its people further than ever from Russia – and the evidence is visible on every street corner, writes Kyle Cowan.

item.title: News24 | Sacked Braverman urges UK PM Sunak to 'change course urgently'
item.description: Outspoken British lawmaker Suella Braverman launched a withering attack on Prime Minister Rishi Sunak Tuesday, urging him to change course to avoid election defeat and slamming his record on immigration and anti-Semitism.

item.title: News24 | Heavy rain in Gaza brings new problems and fears for Palestinians
item.description: Heavy rain in Gaza on Tuesday brought new concerns and challenges for Palestinians, many of whom are homeless and living in makeshift tents after weeks of Israel bombardment.

item.title: News24 | US imposes third round of sanctions on Hamas following attack
item.description: The United States on Tuesday imposed a third round of sanctions aimed at Palestinian militant group Hamas following its attack last month on Israel, targeting leaders and financiers of the group.

item.title: News24 | REPORTING NOTES | Ukraine is rebuilding after Russia's invasion... but showing the scale of atrocities
item.description: Ukraine is reconstructing following Russian attacks - but they are ensuring that monuments and evidence of atrocities are preserved - and shared with the world.

item.title: News24 | REPORTING NOTES | A day’s journey to Kyiv as Russia renews missile attacks and a Polish protest
item.description: A 14-hour bus journey from Warsaw to Kyiv leads to discussions on the EU membership aspirations of Ukraine, why Polish truckers are preventing thousands of Ukrainian trucks from crossing the border and news breaks that Russian missiles have been fired at Kyiv, 52 days since the last attack, writes Kyle Cowan.

item.title: News24 | Biden campaign says Trump echoed Hitler with use of word 'vermin'
item.description: US President Joe Biden's 2024 re-election team on Monday said former President Donald Trump had embraced the language of Nazi German dictator Adolf Hitler by using the word "vermin" to refer to his political enemies.

item.title: News24 | UK's Sunak brings back Cameron, sacks interior minister for a fresh start
item.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak brought back former leader David Cameron as foreign minister on Monday in a reshuffle triggered by his firing of interior minister Suella Braverman after her criticism of police threatened his auth

item.title: News24 | Donald Trump's older sister, an ally and critic, dies aged 86
item.description: Maryanne Trump Barry, a former judge who fell out with him during the later stages of his presidency, has died in New York at the age of 86, US media reported Monday.

item.title: News24 | Read David Cameron's full statement after being named UK foreign minister
item.description: Former British leader David Cameron was named as the country's new foreign secretary on Monday in a surprise appointment made by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak as he reshuffled his top team.
